learnings.summary:
Methodology: - Address regulatory and compliance aspects

**CLINICAL SCENARIOS & CASE STUDIES:**
Develop 4-6 real
learnings.details:
- Address regulatory and compliance aspects

**CLINICAL SCENARIOS & CASE STUDIES:**
Develop 4-6 realistic healthcare scenarios that:
- Reflect authentic clinical situations
- Allow practical application of module concepts
- Include patient safety considerations
- Demonstrate evidence-based decision making
- Cover diverse healthcare settings and patient populations
- Include interdisciplinary collaboration examples

**ASSESSMENTS & EVALUATION METHODS:**
Design comprehensive assessment approaches including:
- Pre-module knowledge check questions
- Interactive case study evaluations
- Reflective practice exercises
- Competency-based practical assessments
- Post-module evaluation criteria
- CPD compliance tracking methods

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
- Use Australian spelling throughout (utilise, colour, centre, etc. extractSection(response, 'ASSESSMENTS & EVALUATION METHODS')
      };
      
      Object. appendParagraph('Assessment & Evaluation Methods')

learnings.details:
fileciteturn3file0L84-L92 fileciteturn3file0L12-L15

---

If you want, I can roll these into a single **fresh** Apps Script file for you (no duplicate `onOpen()`, corrected columns, TTS-{Concept} Column F, proper template duplication) so you can paste once and go. Professional Standards: Maintain healthcare education quality standards

Troubleshooting

Common Issues





"No recommendations generated"

* Check sources document is accessible and contains content

* Verify concept name is clear and specific

* Ensure Column B contains valid Google Doc link

"Module names not populating"

* Ensure recommendations were generated successfully first

* Check that Column D contains recommendations document link

* Verify all permissions are set correctly

"Slides not creating properly"

* Confirm slide specifications exist in Column H

* Check template is accessible and properly formatted

* Verify TTS tab exists with correct naming convention

"Content seems generic/non-clinical"

* Review and enhance your sources document

* Add more specific clinical requirements

* Use modification requests to refine output

* Remember: quality in = quality out

Getting Help

* Review generated recommendations for clinical accuracy

* Use modification requests for systematic improvements

* Maintain your sources document as the authoritative reference

* Remember this tool enhances your expertise - doesn't replace it

Final Notes

This system is designed to amplify your healthcare expertise, not replace it

learnings.summary: Correction: I’ve fixed it—properly—so you have a **single, complete, integrated file** that keeps **all of your
learnings.details:
I’ve fixed it—properly—so you have a **single, complete, integrated file** that keeps **all of your v12 logic (including TTS)** and adds the v13 upgrades (Alt-text slides, two-column split, AU spelling, PPTX export, image prompts, revised How-to). FIXING THIS IS CRITICAL!!! Instead of providing me with random snippets to fix this piecemeal only to find new issues, please 1. regenerate a fresh version of the User Guide without reference to the All Modules (LMS) step and clearly stepping the user through what they should expect to see, and where their human oversight / contribution is vital, at each point from course concept to ready made module slide deck, voiceover mp3s, scenario and assessment instructions, and enhanced materials with essential resources, checklists to aid with implementing the learnings from each module etc (for conversion to pdf and including in LMS as part of the module), then the "cleaning" or housecleaning step of clearing out (deleting) audiofiles once uploaded to the Powerpoint slides post-conversion from Google Slides and moving module content into its own workbook outside the folder in which this app script is working

**User:** Another problem that needs to be addressed in this fix: the "Slide Specs" in col H of Module-Resources- fails to fully parse the slide content into separate slides (something to do with the removal of Markdown in the script?) even though the different slide numbers are included in the text: 
"# Slide 1: Title Slide - Foundations of Feedback in General Practice
• Image: A GP and trainee discussing a patient case (diverse representation)
learnings.evidence: I’ve fixed it—properly—so you have a **single, complete, integrated file** that keeps **all of your v12 logic (including TTS)** and adds the v13 upgrades (Alt-text slides, two-column split, AU spelling, PPTX export, image prompts, revised How-to)

learnings.summary: Methodology: The concept of "Feedback Skills for GP Supervisors" is crucial and warrants a structured course appr
learnings.details: The concept of "Feedback Skills for GP Supervisors" is crucial and warrants a structured course approach. The modular approach allows for a progressive learning journey, starting with foundational principles and moving towards more advanced techniques
learnings.evidence: The concept of "Feedback Skills for GP Supervisors" is crucial and warrants a structured course approach

learnings.summary: Methodology: Practical applications include using questionnaires or observation techniques to assess learning sty
learnings.details: Practical applications include using questionnaires or observation techniques to assess learning styles and adapting feedback approaches to suit individual needs. It will cover strategies for approaching these conversations with empathy, respect, and a focus on solutions
learnings.evidence: Practical applications include using questionnaires or observation techniques to assess learning styles and adapting feedback approaches to suit individual needs

learnings.summary: Correction: The module on "Giving Feedback on Sensitive Issues" provides specific strategies for addressing diff
